entries.meaning: (uncountable) Leather from the skin of a female deer or sheep.
(countable) The hide of a doe, as opposed to a buck.
examples: Frequently, doeskins had a higher value in trade than the skins of bucks, as they were considered of finer quality.

entries.meaning: (countable, chiefly in the plural) A glove made of doeskin leather.
examples: Elizabeth accidentally left her doeskins on the pew at Sunday service.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A very soft, close-napped fabric, especially of high quality.
examples: In the morning Mr. Logan wore a doeskin box coat with pearl buttons nearly as large as alarm clocks in two rows on it.
